com.koucha.experimentalgame.input

Class InputMap

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.koucha.experimentalgame.input.InputMap

  • public class InputMap
extends java.lang.Object
    Maps callbacks (implementing InputMap.Callback) to key codes

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  InputMap.Callback
      Callback interface to be implemented for example through lambda-expressions: (evt) -> { ... }
      protected class  InputMap.Key
      Represents a key and holds a linked list of all callbacks bound to this key
      class  InputMap.Link
      Represents a callback and its display name
      class  InputMap.NoLinkFoundException
      Is thrown, if the search for a key didn't lead to a result, because the key is not registered in the map

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private InputMap.Key[] keyList 
      private int keyListFill 
      private java.util.LinkedList<InputMap.Link> linkList 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      InputMap() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private InputMap.Key addKey(InputMap.Key key)
      Adds a Key to keyList and increases the size of the array if necessary
      private void addLink(int key, InputMap.Link link)
      Ads the callback that's already inside a Link object and its corresponding key to the map and links them
      void addLink(java.lang.String name, int key, InputMap.Callback cb)
      Ads the callback cb and the key to the map and links them
      private void bubbleKey(InputMap.Key key, boolean up)
      Adjusts the position of the Key inside the sorted array if the code of the Key was altered
      private void bufferedMergeSort(InputMap.Key[] source, InputMap.Key[] destination, int start, int end)
      Implementation of the mergesort algorithm on a Key array
      void call(InputEvent evt)
      Forwards a InputEvent to all InputMap.Callback corresponding to the key the InputEvent originates from
      private InputMap.Key findKey(int key)
      Searches the Key array for a key with a given key code
      java.lang.Iterable<InputMap.Link> getLinkIterable()
      Use to iterate over all InputMap.Link objects in the map Ex.: for(Link link : getLinkIterable()) { ... }
      private void sortKeys()
      Sorts the keyList

    • Constructor Detail

      • InputMap

        public InputMap()

    • Method Detail

      • addKey

        private InputMap.Key addKey(InputMap.Key key)
        Adds a Key to keyList and increases the size of the array if necessary
        Parameters:
        key - Key to be added
        Returns:
        key, for chaining (Ex.: addKey( new Key( key ) ).addLink( link ); )

      • addLink

        private void addLink(int key,
                     InputMap.Link link)
        Ads the callback that's already inside a Link object and its corresponding key to the map and links them
        Parameters:
        key - code of the key
        link - object containing the callback and its display name

      • addLink

        public void addLink(java.lang.String name,
                    int key,
                    InputMap.Callback cb)
        Ads the callback cb and the key to the map and links them
        Parameters:
        name - display name of the callback
        key - code of the key
        cb - callback object

      • bubbleKey

        private void bubbleKey(InputMap.Key key,
                       boolean up)
        Adjusts the position of the Key inside the sorted array if the code of the Key was altered
        Parameters:
        key - altered Key
        up - bubble direction (true if new key code > old key code)

      • bufferedMergeSort

        private void bufferedMergeSort(InputMap.Key[] source,
                               InputMap.Key[] destination,
                               int start,
                               int end)
        Implementation of the mergesort algorithm on a Key array
        Parameters:
        source - contains initial (unsorted) array data, WILL BE USED AS BUFFER!
        destination - after execution contains the sorted array
        start - starting index of the range of the array to be sorted
        end - end point of the range of the array to be sorted

      • call

        public void call(InputEvent evt)
          throws InputMap.NoLinkFoundException
        Forwards a InputEvent to all InputMap.Callback corresponding to the key the InputEvent originates from
        Parameters:
        evt - event to be forwarded
        Throws:
        InputMap.NoLinkFoundException - if the map has no entry for the corresponding key

      • findKey

        private InputMap.Key findKey(int key)
                      throws InputMap.NoLinkFoundException
        Searches the Key array for a key with a given key code
        Parameters:
        key - code to be searched for
        Returns:
        Key corresponding Key
        Throws:
        InputMap.NoLinkFoundException - if no Key in the array has the given code

      • getLinkIterable

        public java.lang.Iterable<InputMap.Link> getLinkIterable()
        Use to iterate over all InputMap.Link objects in the map

        Ex.: for(Link link : getLinkIterable()) { ... }

        Returns:
        Iterable for iterating over all Link objects

      • sortKeys

        private void sortKeys()
        Sorts the keyList
